title: Conflict Risk Prediction System for Investment Decision-Making in Africa
highlight: Built using machine learning (Logistic Regression, Random Forest, XGBoost) and CRISP-DM to forecast conflict hotspots using ACLED data, with a focus on investment risk assessment.
description:
This project is a data-driven system that predicts the probability of conflict occurrences across African regions to guide multinational investment decisions. Using the ACLED dataset, the system classifies regions by conflict risk using spatial-temporal analysis, real fatality data, and historical trends. It provides detailed insights including:

- Conflict risk level
- Predicted event type
- Historical trends
- Fatality analysis (including outliers)
- Region-wise investment recommendations

The system is deployed as a Flask-based web app featuring a dynamic Folium map and detailed textual risk summaries. It's ideal for organizations evaluating regional stability for expansion or operations across Africa.

title: Bomapot: Smart Recipe Recommendation Web App
highlight: An intelligent food assistant that suggests recipes based on either ingredients or dish names using NLP and text similarity.
description:
Bomapot is a user-friendly web app that provides personalized cooking suggestions. Users can either input a food name to get its recipe and ingredients, or list ingredients to receive matching food suggestions. The system leverages:

- NLP for food name detection
- Ingredient matching logic for recipe suggestion
- A clean interface to display instructions and images

Ideal for home cooks or anyone looking for quick, creative ideas based on available ingredients.

title: Kenya Constitution Question-Answering Bot
highlight: NLP-powered chatbot trained on the Constitution of Kenya to provide instant legal context and explanations.
description:
This chatbot uses a deep learning model fine-tuned on the Kenyan Constitution to answer legal questions in natural language. It combines NLP techniques such as sentence embeddings and cosine similarity to retrieve the most relevant constitutional clause in response to user queries. Key features include:

- Legal text analysis and interpretation
- Fast, reliable access to civic and legal rights
- Scalable framework for other legal domains
deploymentLink: Hosted in Telegram app using BotFather Token

title: Nitram Cooperative Bank: Simulated Relational Database
highlight: PostgreSQL implementation of a simulated banking system with synthetic financial data for analytics training.
description:
This simulated bank database includes structured tables for customers, transactions, accounts, loans, and branches. Data was generated using Faker, and the schema supports real-world queries for business intelligence. The database is used to train analysts in financial reporting, SQL analytics, and dashboard development. Core components:

- PostgreSQL-based schema
- Synthetic but realistic financial data
- Designed for querying customer insights, loan trends, and branch performance
deploymentLink: Hosted in pg admin a postgress SQL platform

title: Book Recommendation System
highlight: Developement of this Book Recommendation System used CRISP-DM authoring and used content-based filtering using TF-IDF and cosine similarity.
description: This project creates a book recommendation system that suggests personalized books based on user input, such as a book title, author, or publisher. It uses text analysis techniques (TF-IDF and cosine similarity) to find and recommend the top 10 similar books. The system focuses on cleaning and organizing data, making it easy to scale for use in online bookstores, libraries, or schools. The data comes from Goodreads and is cleaned to ensure accurate suggestions. Following a structured approach (CRISP-DM), the system improves user experience by offering tailored recommendations. If no match is found, it prompts users to try a different input.

title: My portfolio Website
highlight: Development of this website used HTML, CSS and JAVASCRIPT
description: This portfolio website highlights my data science and machine learning projects through a professional, user-friendly interface. It features a dynamic projects page with detailed information, including GitHub links, videos, dashboards, slides, and embedded notebook PDFs. The contact page offers multiple communication options, while the sticky navigation bar ensures smooth browsing. The site is built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and hosted on GitHub Pages, providing a shareable link for recruiters and collaborators. It aims to boost my professional visibility, create strong impressions, and simplify the presentation of my work in a polished, accessible format.
comments: The website is interacting well, but requires improvement to be responsive to other screen
